bill_title: extend certain protections against precipitous eviction to certain long-term tenants at will.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend certain protections against precipitous eviction to certain long-term tenants at will. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 43-8-8 be amended to read as follows: 43-8-8. A tenancy or other estate at will, however created, may be terminated by the landlord's giving notice to the tenant in the manner prescribed by § 43-8-9 to remove from the premises within a period, specified in the notice, of not less than one month. However, if the tenancy at will is the residence of the tenant and the resident has resided at that residence for twenty-four months or more, the tenant is entitled to two months' notice in the manner prescribed by § 43-8-9 unless: (1) The tenant has engaged in sustained conduct that is either disruptive to other residents or neighbors, illegal, destructive, or negligent toward the maintenance of the property, or constitutes a material breech in the implied lease conditions; or (2) The landlord has sold the property or the property has passed to the landlord's estate. Section 2. That chapter 43-8 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of section 1 of this Act, if the tenancy at will is the residence of a tenant who is on active military service or if a person on active military service is an immediate family member of the tenant, the tenant is entitled to ninety days notice in the manner prescribed in § 43-8-9.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend certain protections against precipitous eviction to certain long-term tenants at will. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 43-8-8 be amended to read as follows: 43-8-8. A tenancy or other estate at will, however created, may be terminated by the landlord's giving notice to the tenant in the manner prescribed by § 43-8-9 to remove from the premises within a period, specified in the notice, of not less than one month. However, if the tenancy at will is the residence of a tenant who is on active military service or if a person on active military service is an immediate family member of the tenant, the tenant is entitled to two months' notice in the manner prescribed by § 43-8-9 unless: (1) The tenant has engaged in sustained conduct that is either disruptive to other residents or neighbors, illegal, destructive, or negligent toward the maintenance of the property, or constitutes a material breech in the implied lease conditions; or (2) The landlord has sold the property or the property has passed to the landlord's estate. 135 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.075 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend certain protections against precipitous eviction to certain long-term tenants at will. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 43-8-8 be amended to read as follows: 43-8-8. A tenancy or other estate at will, however created, may be terminated by the landlord's giving notice to the tenant in the manner prescribed by § 43-8-9 to remove from the premises within a period, specified in the notice, of not less than one month. However, if the tenancy at will is the residence of a tenant who is on active military service or if a person on active military service is an immediate family member of the tenant, the tenant is entitled to two months' notice in the manner prescribed by § 43-8-9 unless: (1) The tenant has engaged in sustained conduct that is either disruptive to other residents or neighbors, illegal, destructive, or negligent toward the maintenance of the property, or constitutes a material breech in the implied lease conditions; or (2) The landlord has sold the property or the property has passed to the landlord's estate. For the purposes of this section, an immediate family member is a spouse or minor child. 135 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.075 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
